p.seg: Having learned the decease of your second Assistant, Mr Groener,

p.style: font-family: Geneva; margin-left: 0.3335in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.3335in; font-size: 9pt;

note.p: Groener died on 6 February; see M to G. Berry, 7 February 1884.

p.seg: I take the liberty of offering my services for the vacancy thus caused in your department.

As I have been employed under you during your directorship of the botanic Garden for a number of years and as you are also otherwise sufficiently acquainted with my abilities I need not now refer to this subject specially, however if necessary I could supply testimonials also from other sources.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; margin-left: 0.3335in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.3335in; font-size: 9pt;

p.seg: nearly 20 years since I entered the service of the Government and at the present time I am in charge of the labelling Dpt in the Botanic Garden, my income at present is £150 per Annum and I occupy a 6 roomed cottage in the Gardens, free of rent, so that I should not be a gainer in a pecuniary respect, by this transfer, but the duties devolving upon me in your department, would be more in accord with my inclinations and I sincerely believe that I should give thorough satisfaction.
I now solicit therefore that you will kindly submit this my application to the Honorable the Chief Secretary for his favourable consideration.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; margin-left: 0.3335in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.3335in; font-size: 9pt;

note.p: M forwarded French's application, which was duly approved; see M to G. Berry, 9 February 1884 (in this edition as 84-02-09a), and T. Wilson to M, 14 March 1884.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
